004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.geometry;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.Pair;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.proto.Ellipse2dProto;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.struct.Ellipse2dStruct;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.jni.Ellipse2dJNI;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.protobuf.ProtobufSerializable;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.struct.StructSerializable;
013import java.util.Objects;
014
015/** Represents a 2d ellipse space containing translational, rotational, and scaling components. */
016public class Ellipse2d implements ProtobufSerializable, StructSerializable {
017  private final Pose2d m_center;
018  private final double m_xSemiAxis;
019  private final double m_ySemiAxis;
020
021  /**
022   * Constructs an ellipse around a center point and two semi-axes, a horizontal and vertical one.
023   *
024   * @param center The center of the ellipse.
025   * @param xSemiAxis The x semi-axis.
026   * @param ySemiAxis The y semi-axis.
027   */
028  public Ellipse2d(Pose2d center, double xSemiAxis, double ySemiAxis) {
029    if (xSemiAxis <= 0 || ySemiAxis <= 0) {
030      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Ellipse2d semi-axes must be positive");
031    }
032
033    m_center = center;
034    m_xSemiAxis = xSemiAxis;
035    m_ySemiAxis = ySemiAxis;
036  }
037
038  /**
039   * Constructs a perfectly circular ellipse with the specified radius.
040   *
041   * @param center The center of the circle.
042   * @param radius The radius of the circle.
043   */
044  public Ellipse2d(Translation2d center, double radius) {
045    this(new Pose2d(center, Rotation2d.kZero), radius, radius);
046  }
047
048  /**
049   * Returns the center of the ellipse.
050   *
051   * @return The center of the ellipse.
052   */
053  public Pose2d getCenter() {
054    return m_center;
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Returns the rotational component of the ellipse.
059   *
060   * @return The rotational component of the ellipse.
061   */
062  public Rotation2d getRotation() {
063    return m_center.getRotation();
064  }
065
066  /**
067   * Returns the x semi-axis.
068   *
069   * @return The x semi-axis.
070   */
071  public double getXSemiAxis() {
072    return m_xSemiAxis;
073  }
074
075  /**
076   * Returns the y semi-axis.
077   *
078   * @return The y semi-axis.
079   */
080  public double getYSemiAxis() {
081    return m_ySemiAxis;
082  }
083
084  /**
085   * Returns the focal points of the ellipse. In a perfect circle, this will always return the
086   * center.
087   *
088   * @return The focal points.
089   */
090  public Pair<Translation2d, Translation2d> getFocalPoints() {
091    // Major semi-axis
092    double a = Math.max(m_xSemiAxis, m_ySemiAxis);
093
094    // Minor semi-axis
095    double b = Math.min(m_xSemiAxis, m_ySemiAxis);
096
097    double c = Math.sqrt(a * a - b * b);
098
099    if (m_xSemiAxis > m_ySemiAxis) {
100      return new Pair<>(
101          m_center.plus(new Transform2d(-c, 0.0, Rotation2d.kZero)).getTranslation(),
102          m_center.plus(new Transform2d(c, 0.0, Rotation2d.kZero)).getTranslation());
103    } else {
104      return new Pair<>(
105          m_center.plus(new Transform2d(0.0, -c, Rotation2d.kZero)).getTranslation(),
106          m_center.plus(new Transform2d(0.0, c, Rotation2d.kZero)).getTranslation());
107    }
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Transforms the center of the ellipse and returns the new ellipse.
112   *
113   * @param other The transform to transform by.
114   * @return The transformed ellipse.
115   */
116  public Ellipse2d transformBy(Transform2d other) {
117    return new Ellipse2d(m_center.transformBy(other), m_xSemiAxis, m_ySemiAxis);
118  }
119
120  /**
121   * Rotates the center of the ellipse and returns the new ellipse.
122   *
123   * @param other The rotation to transform by.
124   * @return The rotated ellipse.
125   */
126  public Ellipse2d rotateBy(Rotation2d other) {
127    return new Ellipse2d(m_center.rotateBy(other), m_xSemiAxis, m_ySemiAxis);
128  }
129
130  /**
131   * Checks if a point is intersected by this ellipse's circumference.
132   *
133   * @param point The point to check.
134   * @return True, if this ellipse's circumference intersects the point.
135   */
136  public boolean intersects(Translation2d point) {
137    return Math.abs(1.0 - solveEllipseEquation(point)) <= 1E-9;
138  }
139
140  /**
141   * Checks if a point is contained within this ellipse. This is inclusive, if the point lies on the
142   * circumference this will return {@code true}.
143   *
144   * @param point The point to check.
145   * @return True, if the point is within or on the ellipse.
146   */
147  public boolean contains(Translation2d point) {
148    return solveEllipseEquation(point) <= 1.0;
149  }
150
151  /**
152   * Returns the distance between the perimeter of the ellipse and the point.
153   *
154   * @param point The point to check.
155   * @return The distance (0, if the point is contained by the ellipse)
156   */
157  public double getDistance(Translation2d point) {
158    return findNearestPoint(point).getDistance(point);
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Returns the nearest point that is contained within the ellipse.
163   *
164   * @param point The point that this will find the nearest point to.
165   * @return A new point that is nearest to {@code point} and contained in the ellipse.
166   */
167  public Translation2d findNearestPoint(Translation2d point) {
168    // Check if already in ellipse
169    if (contains(point)) {
170      return point;
171    }
172
173    // Find nearest point
174    var nearestPoint = new double[2];
175    Ellipse2dJNI.findNearestPoint(
176        m_center.getX(),
177        m_center.getY(),
178        m_center.getRotation().getRadians(),
179        m_xSemiAxis,
180        m_ySemiAxis,
181        point.getX(),
182        point.getY(),
183        nearestPoint);
184    return new Translation2d(nearestPoint[0], nearestPoint[1]);
185  }
186
187  @Override
188  public String toString() {
189    return String.format(
190        "Ellipse2d(center: %s, x: %.2f, y:%.2f)", m_center, m_xSemiAxis, m_ySemiAxis);
191  }
192
193  /**
194   * Checks equality between this Ellipse2d and another object.
195   *
196   * @param obj The other object.
197   * @return Whether the two objects are equal or not.
198   */
199  @Override
200  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
201    if (obj instanceof Ellipse2d) {
202      return ((Ellipse2d) obj).getCenter().equals(m_center)
203          && ((Ellipse2d) obj).getXSemiAxis() == m_xSemiAxis
204          && ((Ellipse2d) obj).getYSemiAxis() == m_ySemiAxis;
205    }
206    return false;
207  }
208
209  @Override
210  public int hashCode() {
211    return Objects.hash(m_center, m_xSemiAxis, m_ySemiAxis);
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Solves the equation of an ellipse from the given point. This is a helper function used to
216   * determine if that point lies inside of or on an ellipse.
217   *
218   * <pre>
219   * (x - h)²/a² + (y - k)²/b² = 1
220   * </pre>
221   *
222   * @param point The point to solve for.
223   * @return < 1.0 if the point lies inside the ellipse, == 1.0 if a point lies on the ellipse, and
224   *     > 1.0 if the point lies outsides the ellipse.
225   */
226  private double solveEllipseEquation(Translation2d point) {
227    // Rotate the point by the inverse of the ellipse's rotation
228    point = point.rotateAround(m_center.getTranslation(), m_center.getRotation().unaryMinus());
229
230    double x = point.getX() - m_center.getX();
231    double y = point.getY() - m_center.getY();
232
233    return (x * x) / (m_xSemiAxis * m_xSemiAxis) + (y * y) / (m_ySemiAxis * m_ySemiAxis);
234  }
235
236  /** Ellipse2d protobuf for serialization. */
237  public static final Ellipse2dProto proto = new Ellipse2dProto();
238
239  /** Ellipse2d struct for serialization. */
240  public static final Ellipse2dStruct struct = new Ellipse2dStruct();
241}
